catalogue_raissonne: Robert-Dumesnil 40; Blum 42; Mannocci 4;  Russell 6 (as printed together on one sheet with 2015.93.159.2)
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Freely sketched trees on a gentle embankment at left; open space with distant mounds at right; two tiny figures near the trees.
dimension: 2 1/2 × 2 1/4 in. (6.35 × 5.72 cm) (as cut from original sheet)
inscription:
Signature, Stamp

-- in graphite on verso: [*E.G. Kennedy / 18 Nov. 1912]
markings: blue stamps on verso, near center: N.Y. Public Library Print Department / 55713, not in  Lugt
provenance: [Edward G. Kennedy (1849-1932), New York.] New York Public Library Print Department (not in Lugt). [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York; sold March 5, 1985, to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: initialed in plate, lower right: [CL. inv.]
title: The Two Landscapes (Right)
